search_results.snippet: The word "iambic" refers to the type of foot that is used, known as the iamb, which in English is an unstressed syllable followed by a stressed syllable. The word "pentameter" indicates that a line has five of these "feet". ... William Shakespeare used iambic pentameter in his plays and sonnets.
search_results.title: Iambic pentameter - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: A specific type of foot is an iamb. A foot is an iamb if it consists of one unstressed syllable followed by a stressed syllable, so the word remark is an iamb. Pent means five, so a line of iambic pentameter consists of five iambs  five sets of unstressed syllables followed by stressed syllables.
